sources.title: Big Fella
sources.description: A wealthy young boy (Eldon Gorst) who willingly deserts his parents from a luxury ocean liner serves as the catalyst in this rollicking musical highlighting the vocal talents of Paul Robeson.

sources.title: Big Fella (1937) Paul Robeson, Elisabeth Welch, Roy Emerton | Full Movie, subtitles
sources.description:
Joe, a Marseilles docker, is hired by a wealthy English couple to find their missing son. When Joe finds him, he learns he escaped of his own will and takes him to stay with a local singer. They offer him a refuge from his repressed parents.

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/LqGXomnSAgQ
Original title: Big Fella (1937)
Director: J. Elder Wills
Writers:  Claude McKay (novel "Banjo") & Ingram D'Abbes, Fenn Sherie
Stars: Paul Robeson, Elisabeth Welch, Roy Emerton
Genres: Drama, Musical

00:00:00 Full Movie
00:01:46 "Lazin"  Written by Eric Ansell Sung by Paul Robeson 
00:05:13 "When I Get to Heaven" Sung by Paul Robeson 
00:14:08 "One Kiss" by Eric Ansell & James Dyrenforth, Sung by Elisabeth Welch
00:21:47 "Roll Up Sailorman" by Eric Ansell & Henrik Ege, Sung by Paul Robeson
00:33:09 "Ma Curly Headed Baby" by G.H. Clutsam. Sung by Paul Robeson
00:41:05 Tap dancing
00:44:02 "Harlem in My Heart Music" by Eric Ansell & James Dyrenforth, Sung by Elisabeth Welch
00:52:55 "River Steals My Folks from Me" by Michael Carr & Will Grosz, Sung by Paul Robeson
01:07:17 "One Kiss" reprise Sung by Elisabeth Welch

metadata.Plot: In this musical comedy, Paul Robeson stars as Joe, a Marseilles docker hired by a wealthy English couple to find their missing son. When Joe finds him, he learns he escaped of his own will, and takes him to stay with a local singer. They offer him a refuge from his repressed white parents.
metadata.Writer: Ingram D'Abbes, Claude McKay, Fenn Sherie
metadata.Actors: Paul Robeson, Elisabeth Welch, Roy Emerton
